title: England fans detained amid isolated clashes with Prague police prior to Euro 2020 qualifier against Czech Republic
text:
Prague police staged a zero tolerance response to English troublemakers, with riot officers using smoke grenades after bottles were thrown between opposing supporters in the city's Old Town.

An officer on the ground claimed 10 Englishmen had been arrested as an isolated scene of violence erupted with local supporters less than two hours before kick-off.

It had been the only ugly incident during largely good-natured scenes prior to England's Euro 2020 qualifier against the Czech Republic. Officers, however, came prepared for a long and busy night as fans prepared to return to the city's all-night drinking venues after full-time.

Police staged a fearsome show of strength, at times outnumbering the largely well-behaved English fans, who congregated in two Irish bars on the edge of the cobblestoned Old Town.

However, as tempers boiled over among a minority of fans at 7pm, a recorded warning was played in English before the Czech police advanced. Smoke grenades were fired by police as fans were forced back through a small archway as bottles continued to be thrown. About a dozen men were eventually forced into a corner and made to lie face down, while another was seen being pinned to the floor nearby as officers secured the scene.
